reviewText: We had bought a similar movie, Duma, which my family absolutely loved and thought this might be similar.  Watching Cheetah was a total 80s flashback--I had no idea this movie was out in the 80s but now that makes total sense given the wardrobe, the tube socks, the hair, etc.  I had assumed that it had been shelved way back when and was brought out because of the success of Duma.  The movie is enjoyable for a once-through.  Duma is MUCH better.
Cheetah is a wonderful family movie filled with fun and adventure.  The scenery of Africa is amazing and the animals are beautiful!  A movie you don't want to miss!!!!

Cheetah is one of those movies that I wore the tape out on as a kid. It tugged my heartstrings with the poachers and racing schemes. But it also made me smile when I was shown that people *did* care about animals.

I was 8 when it first came out, and my mom made sure I had a copy the moment the tape came out. I played it all the time, along with The Last Unicorn, Labyrinth, and the old Shaggy Dog movies. She had to replace copies every so often, especially after a hurricane decimated my collection.

I'm so glad I have the chance to own this movie again. It makes finals week much easier to bear.
I saw this movie when I was a kid, when I saw it again a bought straight away !!!!! It a great movie about friendship and Cheetahs..

Africa is Alive! In many films the native life and the wildlife of Africa is displayed as part of the movie, and "Cheetah" is no exception. "Cheetah" tells the story of a boy named Ted and a girl named Susan who take a vacation in Africa, because of their father's job. Running approximately 83 minutes long, this Walt Disney production, which was made in 1989 and is centered in Kenya, shows some parts of Africa. This movie is based on the book, "The Cheetah's" written by Alan Caillou. Since this film has been rated "G" it can be enjoyed by children of all ages, and be watched by the grown-up members of the family. Certainly this movie is a unique wildlife epic. "Cheetah" is an adventure!

As is already known, "Cheetah" is set in Kenya Africa. The time that the story is set in is modern times (or modern times back in 1989). The leitmotif of this movie is a cheetah. In the beginning of the movie Ted and Susan are disappointed because they are not aloud to explore the surrounding African wild. They are excited because they are in Africa but saddened that they do not get to see any of it. Finally, however, Ted and Susan find something to liven up their trip. They find a baby Cheetah. A poacher had killed the baby duma's mother (duma is in the native word for cheetah), and Ted and Susan decide to keep her. They named her Duma. Duma grows and grows. She becomes very docile. Growing sad as the time draws near for their departure, Ted and Susan have to say goodbye to Morogo, a native friend who they had met. They will probably never see him or Duma again. Like most movies, the tension in "Cheetah" builds up as it progresses, and as is also the case with other movies, the central characters in "Cheetah" get into tight situations as they have adventures in Africa.

At the beginning of the exciting part, (which is) closer to the end of the movie, Ted and Susan, because they are leaving, have to decide what to do with the cheetah. Should they give the cheetah to a zoo or should they let her go free, into the wild? Duma had forgotten how to hunt, and, in fact, how to be a cheetah, but Ted and Susan decide to release her into the wild. They try to train her. Sneaking into Ted's and Susan's house, snooping around and stealing Duma, Mr. Patel, the local store owner, and two other men, including the ignominious, and deus ex machina poacher, want the cheetah to run in a race of the prolific sport of racing cheetahs against gray hounds. Ted and Susan make an un-astute choice, and go looking for the cheetah by themselves. Only the brave Morogo who coolly and diligently acts as guide through their journey accompanies them. As they make their way through Kenya, They suffer from want of food and water. Ultimately, however, they find the poachers headquarters, where Duma is being trained for the race. At night, they attempt to rescue their beloved cheetah, however, even though they have found Duma, she is not out of the poacher's hands yet.

Unfortunately right when Ted and Susan find Duma, they are caught, put in a cage and left while the evil men start for the race. They somehow escaped. Ted, Susan and Morogo, all began traveling to the location of the race, only to be caught by the searching policemen roaming the roads for them. While at a gas station, they again escape because of the inattentiveness of the policeman, and finally make it to their destination. Sadly, they arrived too late too stop the race but surprisingly Duma, who had fallen behind, put on a burst of speed and triumphantly wins the race. Ted and Susan were able to get their tamed cheetah back, but then they face a choice, either to keep Duma for the few weeks that remained of their stay, or to let her go free and never see her again. Since the ending denouement will not be divulged in this critique, all that can be said is that Ted and Susan made the right choice.

"Cheetah" is a good movie for a quiet evening in which every one wants good entertainment. Cleverly and unnoticeably intertwined within this film, like a large, green, grape vine on a trellis, are several morals, and one, which is as popular as Elvis, because of its invaluable lesson, is "evil never prospers". Although this movie is good there is one fault; Ted does not act his age. Besides the one mistake, the movie "Cheetah" is a very good one.

It brought back so many fond memories to watch a great Disney classic, I was so excited to share this movie with  my son. He also loved it, and it has now become a favorite of his. I would recommend this movie for a wonderful family movie night.

This was my absolute favorite movie when I was a child.  I haven't seen it in years, though I know I have a worn out tape of it somewhere.  I remember the cheetah was adorable and the story, while possibly being typical Disney fluff, was heartwarming.  I'd definitely recommend it as a gift for any child who loves animals.

Incredibly bad. 90% of the (very brief) animal scenes weren't even filmed on the same film stock as the rest of the movie! Every time they cut to an animal, suddenly the picture gets all grainy. Can you say, "Stock Footage"? After seeing this turkey you will.

Absolutely typical Disney gotta-have-a-villain story, only watered down beyond belief. This thing doesn't play like a made-for-Disney-Channel quickie, it plays like a BAD made-for-Disney-Channel quickie. If you love your children, don't buy this thing.

If you want to see how the same basic story can be done better without the need for a Disney villian, have a look at the movie "Duma". (Which isn't a great movie, but anything's better than Disney's "Cheetah".)

This movie is a good old fashioned disney movie, clear cut good guy fighting the bad guy. Though the best film to relate this film to would be White Fang. Pretty much the same story, including the heart felt, get out of my life speech to the cheetah. Yet, still a good enough movie to want to own.

This is a good film! Well to be honest I cant actually remember what happens, been a long time since i watched it! But my uncle is in it, so I have to say it's good don't i! :) Of what I can remember it was good, and I am not easy to satisfy at all! So buy it and see!
This was a good movie I remember this as a kid but sad in the end
So, so..
This was my daughters favorite movie when she was 3 years old! She will be 30 soon and I was so excited when I found it on DVD!

Just like I remembered it. Good Movie.
Played perfectly; no marks or scratches.
My daughter loves cheetas got this book for her for Christmas along with a cheeta beanie Babie. It's a nice book for kids!

I was a huge big cat lover as a kid and watched this every chance I got. I now have a niece who is 5 and in need of quality movies with some educational twist....and here it is. I am glad I can pass this on to her.
Great childhood movie
Very good for young kids.
I used to rent this (in the VHS days!) For my kids and they loved it! Now giving to grandkids..? Love the African music and always like anything about animals  -- and positive theme.
gift-so don't know
Arrived very quickly and in perfect condition. A very nice movie I watched repeatedly when I was little and I'm looking forward to sharing it with my little cousins over the holidays.
It is perfect. My family's favorite movie.
Very good family movie.
It came brand new and just how I remember it being from my childhood!! Thank you!!
love this movie! i used to watch this all the time as a child!
My grandchildren ages 5 and 9 are really into Cheetah' s and they love this movie. They watch it 1 - 2 times a week and even more at times.
Granddaughter loves the DVD.
Great

If you love cheetahs, you will love this movie. Just seeing a cheetah makes me feel relaxed. I can never get enough of seeing cheetahs on the screen (except of course when I go through my local Wildlife Safari--a drive through which includes seeing cheetahs). This is one movie I can watch over and over just to see the cheetah.
Good movie and I love cheetah
Great story, very well done.
Africa was never like this?
Its a great family moive. I've wathched it a long time ago and couldn't find it anywhere.

Another good family movie , about a brother & sister who have to move with their parents to AFRICA. Finding adventure and friends' turns out to be easy for these siblings. their new way of life becomes quickly challenged with POUCHERS , A NEW FRIEND , ALONG WITH A NEW FAMILY PET.The African landscape is gorgeous, And the wildlife is memorable for the whole family. My 7 year old granddaughter and even our 2 year old grandson sat through it , they even named their new kitten DUMA.  DISNEY  Movies are known for the animals , adventures, family, and locations in which the movie is filmed, this disney favorite is no different. For holiday gift giving with kids, this would be great  if it isn't  already 8n their dvd library. THANKS FOR READING, BYE.
great movie
Great movie! We let our kids watch it and we all enjoyed it! :D
Fast delivery and CD was in perfect shape. I love this movie because I was an extra in the movie when it was recorded in Kenya over 25 years ago.
I loved this movie when I was a kid. I instant streamed it recently for my own kids (elementary aged) and they enjoyed it as much as I used to.
Disney is known for their ability to tell a story, and the story line does not disappoint. The footage of African game in the wild is just outstanding though!
It was an awesome purchase!
cute family film

Two teenagers on their way back to America find a Cheetah cub that they raise as a pet. When the grown family pet mysteriously disappears, the search for the cheetah leads the family on exciting adventures across the African wilderness.  A typical Disney wildlife adventure, the film captures the majesty of Africa and its wildlife that is itself disappearing...
Excellent. Realistic example of response to grief. Enjoyed the relational interaction with man & boy on their trek. Values expressed well done.
Cool product. It worked perfect for us. I would buy it if i were you for sure. Thanks again guys.
As a child, I had the VHS copy of cheetah, and my brother and I must have watched it 100 times. My son has the DVD and he liked it very much also.  Perfect family movie.

I remember watching this when I was 5 years old on TV. I watched it again cause I didn't remember any of it except the cheetah racing with the greyhounds at the end. Its a nice family film, but the acting is cheesy especially near the end where Keith Coogan says, "It's the guy who skinned Duma's mother." !!!  It has nice scenes of Kenya from the late 1980s in case you are one of those people who is like, "Oh, so thats what that country looked like then." Not bad, Disney.

Great family movie with beautiful scenery and animal life shots.  We used it as a reward movie for an all school event grades 1-5.  It pleased them all.  Plenty of giggles, ahhhs, and even a few tears.

My friend, Collin was a child actor in it! A superb job for a child of his age. The awareness it brings to the need of protecting wild animals wherever they may be, is bought to the world's attention in a very creative and innocent manner.

I loved the first cheetah movie and decided to buy this as a gift. The product is straightforward, and I cannot vouch for the movie itself, but I can say that the product was exactly as described and arrived very quickly.

What was Disney thinking?  This is so far from the classics Disney used to produce.  The scenery of Africa is nice to look at but let me tell you, the acting is absolutely horrible!!!  That is not to be mean, it truly is bad.  I found myself thinking many times that the movie had to get better as it went along, but not to be.  The bad acting got in the way of the story to the point that it was comical.  I'm sorry I wasted my money on this DVD.  I wouldn't recommend you waste yours.
I was so excited to be able to rewatch a movie that I had loved when I was younger. It was hard to find so I was pleasantly surprised that I found it for rent on here :)

This movie is straight out of the 80s, and pretty much every aspect of the movie shows it.  It's not a bad movie, but you really need to be aware of what you are getting into when you order/watch this. Not bad, but not great either.

This is a great family film.  So nice to find films that don't leave you embarrassed to watch them with your kids.  The kids do disobey their parents to save their cheetah, but all is well in the end.  Might not have been such a good ending if it was real life.
this is a great movie i could watch this movie every day i really love it thank you so much
My family saw this film years ago and my daughters wanted to add it to our library. Delivered on time and in good condition. Very happy with service

If you're looking for the Anamorphic Widescreen version of this movie you'll need to buy the Region 2 UK version at Amazon.co.uk or Cheetah The aspect ratio of this movie is 1.85:1 and looks GREAT on a widescreen TV! But you will need to have a multi region DVD player to play this Region 2 DVD.

I remember seeing this in the movies when i was in my early teens. My brother, was newly married, and he used to take me to the movies quite a bit. We went to see this gem. It has a gripping plot, lots of animals, and what it doesn't have is the sex/violence/foul language that many movies inundate us with.

The plot was already mentioned by several reviewers, but all i want to add is that movies like this show that good clean entertainment CAN be made without being "boring"

Enjoy!

It's a really good family movie!  Being a lifetime lover of African landscapes, it allows me to escape city life, but monetary greed still keeps me there. It's nice to know that people still live in old-fashioned ways - and have old-fashioned values!

I grew up watching this movie and was so excited to see it on here.  Having said that, I realized while watching it that I loved it so much because I was a child and it's a good, clean adventure story.  As an actual movie it's not all that great but if you have kids they will probably love it :)
Loved it! Great movie!

Classic Disney.  The people, critters, good guys, bad guys may change with the movies, but the Disney spin shines through.  We'd all wish the endings in these movies were those in real life.  Reminds me to be kind to strangers, they are just friends we haven't been introduced to yet :)
the movie Duma by disney also is a much better film...this one is a poor attempted copy...the actors in this film were 2nd rate...i was disappointed
I never liked it. I was 12 when it came to the theaters. I am surprised it has almost 5 stars.
this was a gift
This is a great, clean movie and my kids love it!

Keith Coogan was a star actor in this  2002 Disney production and really presented himself as a coming of age teen.  Here was a Brother and Sister with a pet Cheetah who were greatly assisted by the black African boy Morogo.  In the military, on overseas tours I have seen parts of the Middle East, the Nile River and parts of Africa which are excellent in this DVD.  This is good family viewing with a two-fold message about the interior of Africa and the serious problems of poaching or the black-market traffic of animals.  Most important was the portrayal of the wildlife especially the
Cheetah.  Excellent family viewing and very informative that demonstrates Disney had done it again to achieve a 5-star rating.
I remember this movie being one of my favorites in the 90's. I watched it again and realized it is not good. The taping is bad, the acting is bad and it is kind of boring.
Good wildlife story, as well as about Africa
Cute for family movie night - my 6 year old and I both enjoyed it.
